attributes.action: order the Home Office to reverse the action taken in pursuit of its decision to deport Ama Sumani, and to do so on compassionate grounds
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Ama Sumani, a terminally ill, 39-year-old Ghanaian woman, a widow and mother-of-two living in Cardiff, was deported in January 2008 following the expiration of her student visa, the terms of which she had violated after she came to the UK to study and ran into personal difficulties. Though not entitled to a bone-marrow transplant from the NHS, she had been undergoing dialysis at a general hospital in Cardiff, the only thing that was keeping her alive. Now that she has returned to Ghana, her life is at risk, as she cannot afford long-term the treatment she needs.

rejection.details: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
